subSections.text: {{zh-der|情意綿綿|海綿體|海綿動物|病榻纏綿|礦綿|海綿蛋糕|瓜瓞綿綿|撏綿扯絮|海綿鐵|沉綿|福壽綿長|福壽綿綿|水綿|摘綿術|石綿|河綿|海綿田|海綿|海綿刷|綿弓|連綿|綿綿瓜瓞|綿綢|綿絮|綿羊|綿軟|綿紬|綿延不絕|綿歷|連綿字|纏綿悱惻|綿山|綿密|綿蠻|纏綿|綿長|綿子|綿衣|綿綴|綿綿|綿裹秤鎚|綿亙|綿上|綿紙|綿裡針|芊綿|綿邈|綿密小巧|綿延|綿綿不斷|綿花嘴|綿聯|綿力薄材|連綿不絕|聯綿字|綿綿不息|綿力|軟綿綿|連綿不斷|綿篤|網水綿|連綿起伏|綿纏|裡牽綿|綿惙|綿頓|聯綿對|綿延起伏|聯綿字典|綿薄|綿毛}}

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|木綿|木綿 (cotton)}} {{wikipedia|Cotton}} [[File:CottonPlant.JPG|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|綿}} (''men'', ''wata''): raw [[cotton]] on the bush.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|めん}} From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=めん}} {{m|zh|綿|tr=miɛn||wool; cotton; soft, downy}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|めん}}

# [[cotton]] {{qualifier|both the fiber and the cloth}}

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: As a standalone noun, the term {{m|ja|木綿|tr=momen||cotton|lit=tree or bush + woolly batting}} is used more often. This is especially true in speech, to avoid ambiguity with the various homophones, such as {{m|ja|面|tr=men||face}} or {{m|ja|麺|tr=men||noodle}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|わた}} From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=わた}}. Originally referred to any [[batting]] or [[stuffing]], which was generally unspun [[silk]]. The meaning shifted after the spread of [[cotton]] in the {{w|Muromachi period}}.
